title: How to improve my English for the UPSC Mains answer writing and essay writing - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Hello there! Improving your English for the UPSC mains answer writing and Essay writing is very significant because our answers project our personality and if we are not successful in improving our English , it would be difficult to make the cut. Coming to the question , by ‘’English in UPSC’’ refers to ‘’ simple English’’ . No need to use jargon always. It is always recommended to explain answers in a very simple and understandable language( Ofcourse , standard terminology is a must ). How to improve English for UPSC ? Read a lot of primary standard textbooks in the initial stages.Read a lot of online articles related to simple topics and understand the way they introduce the topic and put their thoughts forward.Learn atleast 2–3 glossary everyday.If you have heard about Fiction writing competitions , take part in it . Instead you can do it at your home. For e.g: If i give you a sentence like , I WAS SURPRISED TO SEE MY FRIEND …. now you will continue writing your own story . Thereby , your English shall improve and thought processing as well.Start listening to TedX talks with subtitles.So , Improving your English is not a huge task. A big NO ! . Put your thinking cap on and all you need to do is to put your heart and soul into whatever you do. That is the secret to success. Hope this helps you. Thank you!

Bitu, I have to say I wouldn’t have thought of Nadine’s answer (see hereabouts), nor would I have thought of anything better. All I would add is, try to use the posh words correctly and watch the spelling. Your computer should keep you out of trouble, at least where the spelling is concerned. Whether this counts as improving your English, I’m not all that sure. Only you can decide whether you’d benefit from a few classes.
